metadata.synopsis: An elderly druid who would like nothing more than for the player to leave. Depending on what the player has done, he will be civil about it, but still incistent. If the child has died, he is openly hostile.

0.speaker: Loic
0.text: Shadow Druids... To think we were rotting from within. I'm sorry. I need a moment.
0.context: InternalNodeContext: TODO: Add Shadow Druid Flag. Reaction for after the player exposed the Shadow druid plot. I don't know if he'll be part of the druids who fight alongside Sagha (I don't know if all pro-sagha druids do). But this works both if Sagha got convinced and if she's dead.NodeContext: They just discovered that their boss was being influenced by an evil organisation.

1.speaker: Loic
1.text: Begone. You'll only help this grove by leaving it to us.

3.text: Please leave. Our hospitality has limits - and they were crossed long ago.

4.speaker: Loic
4.text: We never meant to hurt a child... you should leave. This grove has been disrupted enough.
4.context: NodeContext: He's coming to terms with what happened (a snake killed a child).
